description: Kudos to devs for making this app available on Linux, working perfectly on Fedora Linux KDE 40! But for some reason, it does not like EXFAT filesystem, but it works perfectly fine with NTFS.
would be great if it had plugins
It just throws me an error "Permission denied"

Does not seem to be maintained anymore. At its peak, was one of the best IDE for C and C++ and was my favourite. It has always lacked in intellisense and auto-completion but made up for both with its build system which was superior to most other C and C++ editors. Since version 16/17 it had bugs that have not been fixed. Its maintainers seem to have gone silent. It is atleast a great relic.
summary: Does not seem to be maintained anymore

description: This is excellent for someone learning C, it has everything you need built in. Touch wood, I have not had one hiccup with this. It is the same across platforms, so it looks and works the same everywhere. Can definitely recommend.
summary: The more I use it, the more I like it

description:
I was hesitant based on reviews - but the install worked perfectly. Not sure what needs to be adjusted from Ubuntu (note that was the common denominator I notice from users reporting issues) - but so far everything is running as expected and without issue on Fedora. 

Recommend it over eclipse any day...
